solution_line_template: There are twice as many cows in Devonshire as there are hearts on a standard deck of 52 playing cards, meaning there are {multiplier_cows}*{total_hearts_in_deck} = <<{multiplier_cows}*{total_hearts_in_deck}={num_cows}>>{num_cows} cows in Devonshire.
The total cost of the cows when they are sold at ${price_per_cow} each is {num_cows}*${price_per_cow} =$<<{num_cows}*{price_per_cow}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
